thread.title: Porthcawl Maritime Centre project gets £2m in EU cash - BBC News
thread.title_full: Porthcawl Maritime Centre project gets £2m in EU cash - BBC News

title: Porthcawl Maritime Centre project gets £2m in EU cash - BBC News
text:
Porthcawl Maritime Centre project gets £2m in EU cash 21 February 2017 Image copyright Porthcawl Harbourside A new maritime centre on the south Wales coast has secured £2.1m in EU funding. 
Science and Skills Secretary Julie James will announce the cash on a visit to Porthcawl in Bridgend county on Tuesday. 
Porthcawl Maritime Centre will include water sports and exercise facilities, a coastal science centre and an outdoor theatre. 
It is hoped work will begin in the summer and it will open by 2019. 
The £2.1m for the development, which is being built on land owned by Bridgend council, has come from the European Regional Development Fund. 
It is expected to cost in excess of £7m and has already secured lottery funding. Image copyright Porthcawl Harbourside
